summary: my SHOCKING twist-filled ending to the series
body:
my SHOCKING twist-filled ending to the series

arya’s head is titled back, sun shining down on her, the endless expanse of the sea stretching out before her

she breathes in the fresh air

the camera pans to her hand, cradling a clearly pregnant stomach

“arya,” a voice calls out behind her, all but drowned out by the sound of the water

she turns, smiling

at gendry, their young daughter preoccupied with the seashells that dot the beach

gendry lays his hand over hers

“i hope the little lady isn’t too angry with her poor father and sister for intruding”

“i think,” arya touches his chin, “it might be a boy this time”

they kiss, storm’s end in the distance as waves crash against the shore

blog.title: Do I Dare Disturb the Universe?

summary: I actually can‘t remember any man on the show proposing to his lover. It’s either arranged marriages or no marriage at all and...
body: I actually can‘t remember any man on the show proposing to his lover. It’s either arranged marriages or no marriage at all and just an affair. Gendry is literally the first man on this show to not only propose to his gf but even doing it in the traditional way and getting down on one knee. Like can you believe Arya Stark, a girl known for being a tomboy, fighter, badass warrior, is the only female character that got her man to kneel before her and propose after like a week of being together? Wow. What a powerful queen.

summary:
Man: my lord, how should we prepare the feast?
Gendry: that’s a good question, probably with some food, maybe some uhhh,...
body:
Man: my lord, how should we prepare the feast?

Gendry: that’s a good question, probably with some food, maybe some uhhh, utensils

Man: my lord?

Gendry: *begins to panic* *grabs a quill and paper*

“Dear Arya, I’ve been asked how to prepare a feast, I do not know how to prepare a feast, please help.

-love Gendry

-your friend Gendry

summary: All I do is seethe.
body:
All I do is seethe.

I don’t know if anyone listens to the podcast Binge Mode but it was essentially the only GOT podcast that actually discussed the AryaxGendry storyline AND IT WAS DONE SOOOO POORLY. They completely disregarded Gendry as this truly standup dude (in a world of many shitty men) who cares for and has always cared for Arya and turned him into this lovesick puppy trope. I’d go into more detail but I’ve been thinking about it since I listened (I didn’t make it much past that because I was *that* angry) and it’s ruining my day. But anyway. Basically I’m refusing to believe this is how it ends for these two and I want to write fix-it fic but I don’t know where to start because I’m just ANGRY. Why spend so much time introducing these characters, showing how they feel about each other, only for them to stay apart? How does that advance the plot? What character growth is shown there? It’s certainly not fan service. I don’t think it’s how GRRM will end things so you can’t blame it on him. WHY? WHYYYYYYYYY?


Nope. Not an option. They’re endgame. Thanks for coming to my TED talk.

tags: too bloody lowborn to be kin to m'lady high
summary: repost from freefolk, visenyarose:  "I'll smith for you." Gendry went to one knee before Lord Beric. "If you'll have me, m'lord,...
body:
repost from freefolk, visenyarose: 

“I’ll smith for you.” Gendry went to one knee before Lord Beric. “If you’ll have me, m'lord, I could be of use. I’ve made tools and knives and once I made a helmet that wasn’t so bad. One of the Mountain’s men stole it from me when we was taken.”

Arya bit her lip. He means to leave me too.

Jaqen was gone, though. He’d left her. Hot Pie left me too, and now Gendry is leaving. Lommy had died, Yoren had died, Syrio Forel had died, even her father had died, and Jaqen had given her a stupid iron penny and vanished. “Valar morghulis,” she whispered softly, tightening her fist so the hard edges of the coin dug into her palm. “Ser Gregor, Dunsen, Polliver, Raff the Sweetling. The Tickler and the Hound. Ser Ilyn, Ser Meryn, King Joffrey, Queen Cersei.” Arya tried to imagine how they would look when they were dead, but it was hard to bring their faces to mind.

It was her own fault, for taking Gendry and Hot Pie with her when she left Harrenhal. She would have been better alone. If she had been alone, the outlaws would never have caught her, and she’d be with Robb and her mother by now. They were never my pack. If they had been, they wouldn’t leave me.

That was the best part, the dreaming. She dreamed of wolves most every night. A great pack of wolves, with her at the head. She was bigger than any of them, stronger, swifter, faster. She could outrun horses and outfight lions. When she bared her teeth even men would run from her, her belly was never empty long, and her fur kept her warm even when the wind was blowing cold. And her brothers and sisters were with her, many and more of them, fierce and terrible and hers. They would never leave her.

Arya leaving is not Arya.

tags: actually got hopeful for a second
summary: Leaks discussions about Arya
body:
Leaks discussions about Arya

Can’t hide because I’m on mobile.

.

.

.

I just read an interesting theory on Freefolk about how D&D put Arya, Dany and Cersei in the same catagory of gaining some sort of sadistic pleasure from their kills. The post pointed out that Arya’s kills are people who have done horrible acts against her family or other innocent people unlike Dany or Cersei. Yet she’s seen as this ruthless and heartless killer. She was not able to complete her training as a Faceless Man because she couldn’t kill for no purpose. And potentially we will see her helping people escape KL during the battle as opposed to completing her mission of killing Cersei. I just don’t think they can give her the other big kill of the season. Maybe she’ll flash back to when she had to escape after Ned’s execution and that will aid in her regaining that humanity that’s bubbling to the surface. I’ve honestly felt really hopeless and there’s still a 60/40 or worse chance they might blow it. It doesn’t help that most reactions to episode 4 that I’ve seen on YouTube, people see her as ruthless without the ability to be a real person during the proposal scene so at face value a lot of fans won’t understand her arc if they redeem her heart I fear. But that post did give me some hope again that the path is laid out for her to regain that humanity and I’ll be pissed if they completely forego those years of set up.

I’ve honestly felt really hopeless and there’s still a 60/40 or worse chance they might blow it. It doesn’t help that most reactions to episode 4 that I’ve seen on YouTube, people see her as ruthless without the ability to be a real person during the proposal scene so at face value a lot of fans won’t understand her arc if they redeem her heart I fear. But that post did give me some hope again that the path is laid out for her to regain that humanity and I’ll be pissed if they completely forego those years of set up.
trail.content:
Leaks discussions about Arya

Can’t hide because I’m on mobile.

.

.

.

I just read an interesting theory on Freefolk about how D&D put Arya, Dany and Cersei in the same catagory of gaining some sort of sadistic pleasure from their kills. The post pointed out that Arya’s kills are people who have done horrible acts against her family or other innocent people unlike Dany or Cersei. Yet she’s seen as this ruthless and heartless killer. She was not able to complete her training as a Faceless Man because she couldn’t kill for no purpose. And potentially we will see her helping people escape KL during the battle as opposed to completing her mission of killing Cersei. I just don’t think they can give her the other big kill of the season. Maybe she’ll flash back to when she had to escape after Ned’s execution and that will aid in her regaining that humanity that’s bubbling to the surface. I’ve honestly felt really hopeless and there’s still a 60/40 or worse chance they might blow it. It doesn’t help that most reactions to episode 4 that I’ve seen on YouTube, people see her as ruthless without the ability to be a real person during the proposal scene so at face value a lot of fans won’t understand her arc if they redeem her heart I fear. But that post did give me some hope again that the path is laid out for her to regain that humanity and I’ll be pissed if they completely forego those years of set up.

tags: how long am i going to defend Arya for being a decent human being?
summary: Regarding the Arya “spoilers” about ep5  [[MORE]] Im so tired of people either negating Arya’s strength as “she is just a cold...
body:
Regarding the Arya “spoilers” about ep5 

Im so tired of people either negating Arya’s strength as “she is just a cold murderer who doesn’t care about people” , to now “label” her useless because she rather “save” kids than kill Cersei. The amount of double standards …..

“ Arya shouldn’t kill Cersei , she killed the NK”

“ Why Arya saves random kids instead of Cersei, she is truly useless”

The whole season goes like :

“Arya is just a bodyguard for Sansa and can’t make her own decisions” 

- Arya goes to kill the NK - sends her sister to the crypt and saves Bran - comforts Jon as no one else so far in the entire season reminding him - he is family and her only brother - gave BLOODY CREDIT to Dany that they needed her - no one mentions that at all btw . 

“ Arya has no feelings for Gendry, she just wanted the D before war”

-Arya congratulates Gendry for his legitimation - kisses him softly and tells him how good of a Lord he will become and that a lot of girls would want to marry him. 

“Arya has one goal to kill Cersei and she is not a hero anymore but an assasin”

Arya has a hero complex - Beric dying saving her - she can’t see herself as a hero but as someone who needs to take revenge on her familys slaughter , also overthrow Cersei since Jon revealed his parentage and he would be a better king . Arya spents time with commoners - she is barely around  Sansa in the castle other than “meetings” . The entire opening of the season was her smiling at a boy reminding her of Bran . 

“Arya is useless since she rather saves kids instead of killing the Queen”

The amount of “statements” this week regarding killing innocent people is giving me headache. Arya is battling with herself of taking her revenge or saving little kids - and she does the latter and she is useless? HOW? If anything she proves she is not emotionless assasin but rather a true hero who will save people like she already did . 

Y all just hate Arya for existing and that shows . 

She also saved Lady Crane . Can we establish that Arya kills the ones who wronged her family but they are murderers themselves ? She hasn’t kill so far (corrent me if im wrong) someone who just looked at her the wrong way. She managed to be in the company of lannister soldiers and understand the meaning of war and that not everyone who is not a Stark is an evil person who is out for blood. 

So if Arya abandons her list and saves kids is the definition of her humanity and shows what a truly good person she is and a hero , even though she doesn’t believe in them anymore because of her trauma. 

Arya is been written as the female version of bloody Batman - minus the face of being Bruce Wayne - she is the typical (Well D&D courtecy since in the books she is different) heroine that something happened in her family, she turns cold and with one goal to get revenge, right at the moment she doesn’t “feel” anything anymore she realises that she still has feelings - can fall in love - love her family- save people’s lives and also (hopefully) find peace without her heart being full of hate and anger. I can sit down and name a lot of characters written the same way. 

If Arya had chosen to let people die in order to find Cersei people would be up calling her “evil” and that she has no feelings or humanity. Please pick a side. You want her good or evil. CHOOSE .

blog.title: Miles to go before I sleep

tags: i mean i do get why they did it i really do
and people would likely have ladilike expectations of her
but i was waiting for that moment of realization that being a lady can equate being a lord
summary: Can’t Arya be the lady of Storms End and still remain who she is? I mean she’s gotta live somewhere right? And she wanted to be...
body:
Can’t Arya be the lady of Storms End and still remain who she is? I mean she’s gotta live somewhere right? And she wanted to be a lord is season 1. I’m sure Gendry wouldn’t insist on her being a traditional lady.

I don’t get this show’s insistance on equating being a lady to being a damsel (which there still isn’t anything wrong with). You don’t need to have a sword to be a strong female character but Arya does anyway and I wish she had come to the conclusion by the end of her character arc that there’s nothing insulting about femininity.

summary: Arya shouldn’t go to Kingslanding
body:
Arya shouldn’t go to Kingslanding

I think that the way the writing has been in season 8 is all over the place. Arya gives up her quest to kill Cersei and goes to Winterfell instead after hearing that Jon is in the North. She also says that she stands by Sansa because she is protecting their family.

Right before Jon has Bran tell them the truth about his identity she says that they must stick together. Yet the next scene she doesn’t care if she returns alive?

Sorry but that’s terrible writing. Arya has grown in her character to realize that protecting her family is what’s important but then backtracks to giving it all up for revenge.

summary: Gendrya - new spoiler ;)
title: Gendrya - new spoiler ;)
body:
Ok, so I found the information that Maisie filmed at least two scenes with children- one boy around 7-8 and one around 4. She still have none of these scenes in GOT so I was thinking. Just like Ned said

,,Your sons will be knights and princes and lords” 

Always wondering why Ned said ,,princes”. Understand ,,knights” and ,,lords” but is it truth that only king’s sons are princes? What was Ned thinking? What was D&D thinking? Remember, it was first season, very closed to books, highly specified with GRR.

Important clue- In book Ned said ,,You will marry a king”, in show ,,You will marry a high lord”.
